intro: Fumaria agraria var. elata, commonly known as the tall greater celandine, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and broad, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along riverbanks. Its medicinal properties have been historically used in traditional remedies.
